trans-unit.source: Provides design-time support in a designer host for the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.HierarchicalDataBoundControl"></xref> control.

In a designer host, when the user switches from Source to Design view, the markup source code that describes a control that is derived from the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.HierarchicalDataBoundControl> abstract class is parsed and a design-time version of the control is created on the design surface.
When the user switches back to Source view, the design-time control is persisted to markup source code and edited into the markup for the Web page.
The HierarchicalDataBoundControlDesigner class provides design-time support for controls that are derived from the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.HierarchicalDataBoundControl> in a designer host.

The HierarchicalDataBoundControlDesigner class properties provide the following functionality: - The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.HierarchicalDataBoundControlDesigner.ActionLists%2A> property returns a <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.DesignerActionListCollection> object, which typically contains an object that is derived from the <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.DesignerActionList> class for each level in the inheritance tree of the designer.
- The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.HierarchicalDataBoundControlDesigner.DataSourceDesigner%2A> property provides access to the designer of the data source, if one is defined.
- The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.HierarchicalDataBoundControlDesigner.DesignerView%2A> property gets the default view of the data source that is bound to the associated control.

- The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.HierarchicalDataBoundControlDesigner.UseDataSourcePickerActionList%2A> property determines whether the control should render its default action lists for choosing and creating data sources.

The HierarchicalDataBoundControlDesigner class methods provide the following functionality: - The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.HierarchicalDataBoundControlDesigner.ConnectToDataSource%2A> method performs the actions that are necessary to connect to the current data source.
- The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.HierarchicalDataBoundControlDesigner.CreateDataSource%2A> method creates a new data source for the associated control.

- The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.HierarchicalDataBoundControlDesigner.DataBind%2A> method binds the associated control that is derived from the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.HierarchicalDataBoundControl> class to a design-time data source.

- The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.HierarchicalDataBoundControlDesigner.DisconnectFromDataSource%2A> method performs the actions that are necessary to disconnect from the current data source.
- The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.HierarchicalDataBoundControlDesigner.GetDesignTimeDataSource%2A> method gets a data source that can be used at design time for the associated control.

- The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.HierarchicalDataBoundControlDesigner.GetSampleDataSource%2A> method constructs a sample data source that can be used at design time for the associated control.

- The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.HierarchicalDataBoundControlDesigner.PreFilterProperties%2A> method is used to remove properties from or add additional properties to or to shadow properties of the associated control that is derived from the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.HierarchicalDataBoundControl> class.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.HierarchicalDataBoundControlDesigner"></xref> class.

The .NET Framework internally constructs a new instance of the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.HierarchicalDataBoundControlDesigner> class when it creates the associated control that is derived from the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.HierarchicalDataBoundControl> class or a copy of that control on the design surface.
Gets the designer action list collection for this designer.
The ActionLists property creates an empty <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.DesignerActionListCollection> object.
The <xref href="System.ComponentModel.Design.DesignerActionListCollection"></xref> associated with this designer.
Performs the actions that are necessary to connect to the current data source.

The ConnectToDataSource method disconnects the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.DataSourceDesigner.DataSourceChanged> and <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.DataSourceDesigner.SchemaRefreshed> events from the previous data source, and then attaches these events to the new data source.

<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if a connection to a new data source was performed; <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref> if the old and new data source are the same.
Creates a new data source for the associated control.

The CreateDataSource method displays a dialog box that can be used to create a data source for the associated control that is derived from the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.HierarchicalDataBoundControl> class.
Binds the associated control to the design-time data source.

The DataBind method first sets the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.BaseDataBoundControl.DataSource%2A> property of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.HierarchicalDataBoundControl> control to reference the design-time data source and sets the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.HierarchicalDataBoundControl.DataSourceID%2A> property to `null`.

The DataBind calls back to the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.BaseDataBoundControl.DataBind%2A> method of the control that is derived from the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.HierarchicalDataBoundControl> class to bind to the design-time data source.

Finally, it restores the original values of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.BaseDataBoundControl.DataSource%2A> and <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.HierarchicalDataBoundControl.DataSourceID%2A> properties.

The `dataBoundControl` parameter is the control that is derived from the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.HierarchicalDataBoundControl> class that is associated with this designer, or a copy of that control.
The <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.HierarchicalDataBoundControl"></xref> to bind to the design-time data source.
Provides access to the designer of the data source, when one is selected for data binding.

The data source can be accessed using the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.BaseDataBoundControlDesigner.DataSource%2A> property of the designer or the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.BaseDataBoundControl.DataSource%2A?displayProperty=fullName> property of the associated control that is derived from the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.HierarchicalDataBoundControl> class.

The designer for the data source of the associated control derived from the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.HierarchicalDataBoundControl"></xref>, which implements the <xref href="System.Web.UI.Design.IHierarchicalDataSourceDesigner"></xref>.
Gets the default view of the data source that is bound to the associated control.

The data source can be accessed using the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.BaseDataBoundControlDesigner.DataSource%2A> property of the designer or the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.BaseDataBoundControl.DataSource%2A?displayProperty=fullName> property of the associated control that is derived from the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.HierarchicalDataBoundControl> class.
The <xref href="System.Web.UI.Design.DesignerHierarchicalDataSourceView"></xref> representing the default view of the data source.
Performs the actions that are necessary to disconnect from the current data source.

The DisconnectFromDataSource method disconnects the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.DataSourceDesigner.DataSourceChanged> and <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.DataSourceDesigner.SchemaRefreshed> events from the current data source.
Gets a data source that can be used at design time for the associated control.

For performance reasons, it is better to use a simple predefined data source at design time rather than the actual data source for the control that is derived from the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.HierarchicalDataBoundControl> class.

An object implementing the <xref href="System.Web.UI.IHierarchicalEnumerable"></xref> interface that can be used as a data source for controls derived from the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.HierarchicalDataBoundControl"></xref>.
Constructs a sample data source that can be used at design time for the associated control.
The sample data constructed by the GetSampleDataSource method has a single node with an empty path.

An object implementing the <xref href="System.Web.UI.IHierarchicalEnumerable"></xref> interface that can be used as a data source for controls derived from <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.HierarchicalDataBoundControl"></xref>.
Used by the designer to remove properties from or add additional properties to the display in the **Properties** grid or to shadow properties of the associated control.

Control designers use methods that are derived from the <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.ComponentDesigner.PreFilterProperties%2A?displayProperty=fullName> method to shadow various control properties with corresponding design-time properties that the designer implements, and to add properties to or remove properties from the **Properties** grid.

For controls that are derived from the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.HierarchicalDataBoundControl> class, the PreFilterProperties method creates design-time properties to shadow the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.BaseDataBoundControl.DataSource%2A> and <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.HierarchicalDataBoundControl.DataSourceID%2A> properties.
A collection implementing the <xref:System.Collections.IDictionary> of the added and shadowed properties.
Gets a value that indicates whether the control should render its default action lists, which contain a data source ID drop-down list and related tasks.

The default action lists for the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.HierarchicalDataBoundControlDesigner> class include a **Choose Data Source** menu item that has a drop-down list from which a data source can be selected, and any other action items on the action lists of the data source control.
Typically, the data source control action lists will include **Configure Data Source** and **Refresh Schema** menu items, although these need not always be present.
The **Configure Data Source** menu item displays a dialog box that is appropriate to the type of data source chosen.

For example, if the data source is an <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ObjectDataSource> control, the **Configure Data Source** dialog box allows you to choose a business object for the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ObjectDataSource>.
The **Refresh Schema** menu item refreshes the designer schema that is applied by the data source.
Always <xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref>.
